To the Editor: Thanks for ''Renaissance Loses Insurers'' (Practical Traveler, March 26). We bought a Renaissance cruise on Feb. 5, leaving on May 10, and bought Access America trip insurance from AAA on Feb. 10.

We received the policy but then read the article. When we went to the AAA ofice the next day to ask about our coverage, we were told by a surprised staff that Access America would not honor the cancellation-interruption clause of the policy.
In two days, AAA called to assure us that we would be covered by them or Access America. This was confirmed by mail. Imagine if we had not read the article.
